definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]

sentences.english: Convinced of his own righteousness, he was the perfect impersonation of a man of rectitude .
sentences.chinese: 他确信自己很正直，可以完美地扮演刚正不阿的人。

sentences.english: Convinced of his own righteousness, he was the perfect impersonation of a man of rectitude.
sentences.chinese: 他确信自己很正直，可以完美地扮演刚正不阿的人。

definition: not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
to hate evil as one hates an enemy (idiom)
to maintain the law as firm as a mountain (idiom); to enforce the law strictly
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
